[Government](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/Government)/City Government

City Government
===============

About City Hall
---------------

Arlington Municipal Building is located at 101 W. Abram Street, Arlington, TX 76010.

Arlington Municipal Building, or City Hall, is the seat of local government in Arlington. The building was erected in 1980 and houses a number of City departments. City Council meetings are held at the Municipal Building on Tuesdays in the Council Chamber. For information on Arlington city government, please see the categories at left.

The City of Arlington was incorporated on April 19, 1884. On January 17, 1920, the City Charter was adopted by the City Council. In 1949, the City adopted the City-Manager form of government, which authorizes the City Council to function as the City's legislative body.

---

[City Council
------------

![](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/files/assets/city/v/2/city-manager/images/city-council-chamber.jpg?dimension=smallthumbnail&w=150&h=100)

Learn about the City’s governing body, its council members, their roles and responsibilities, and how residents can get involved.](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/Government/City-Government/City-Council)

[City Attorney
-------------

The City Attorney's Office provides legal counsel and advice to the Mayor, City Council, City Manager, officers, agents, employees, and all departments, offices, agencies, boards, and commissions of the City of Arlington.  
  
Molly Shortall is the City Attorney.](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/Government/City-Government/City-Attorney)

[City Auditor
------------

![](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/files/assets/city/v/1/city-auditor/images/city-auditor.jpg?dimension=smallthumbnail&w=150&h=100)

The City Auditor’s Office is responsible for conducting performance audits, to include operational, compliance and information technology audits. The City Auditor’s Office performs special audits as requested or as considered necessary. The Office also monitors the City’s fraud hotline and provides assistance to the City’s external audit firm.](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/Government/City-Government/City-Auditor)

[City Manager
------------

![](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/files/assets/city/v/2/city-manager/images/city-manager-group.jpg?dimension=smallthumbnail&w=150&h=100)

The City Manager’s Office in Arlington is key to the city's operations, overseeing departments and ensuring effective governance.](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/Government/City-Government/City-Manager)

[City Secretary
--------------

![](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/files/assets/city/v/2/city-secretary/images/i-voted-today.jpg?dimension=smallthumbnail&w=150&h=100)

City Secretary's Office serves key functions such as managing city records, overseeing elections, and supporting the City Council.](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/Government/City-Government/City-Secretary)

[Boards & Commissions
--------------------

Members assist the Mayor and City Council and make recommendations on general policy matters that impact where you live. Most boards and commissions function in advisory capacities, and some have final decision-making authority.](https://www.arlingtontx.gov/Government/City-Government/Boards-Commissions)

Contact Us

### Hours

The City Hall is open to the public Monday to Friday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.
